pages.text: This section will outline current generators available, as well as energy storage.
This will harness the power of a Gearbox and convert kinetic energy to electrical energy. For more information, view the $(l:age3)Electrical Age Walkthrough.
This device will convert all flammables into electric energy. Every piece of fuel will burn for 60 seconds, but the amount of energy produced/tick will depend on the fuel used.
This device can store up to 2.5MFE, supporting distribution on all sides except the front.$(p)It can also automatically push or pull energy from surrounding blocks, up to 2KFE/t.

These two generators are cut from the same cloth. Both can take in a fluid, but which fluid is where they are different.$(p)The Combustion Generator can take in the Oil byproducts, Diesel and Gasoline.$(p)The Geothermal Generator can take in Lava.

To get Diesel and Gasoline, Oil is pumped into the Refinery with the Separation Attachment. This will produce Gasoline and Diesel at a 5:3 ratio. For more info, please view the $(l:age3)Electrical Age Walkthrough.$()$(p)Both of these generators can also accept the Active Cooling Upgrade.

pages.title: Active Cooling Upgrade
pages.text: This adds a secondary fluid tank to these generators, for coolant, in exchange for the total amount of power/bucket of fuel being increased.$(p)Water offers a x2 multiplier, while Condensed Void offers a x4 multiplier.
This serves as an augment to the Coal Generator, which can greatly increase the power output. Smoldering Stone is obtained in the Refinery, combining Cobblestone and Naphtha with Addition Attachment.

Place the Turbine on the Coal Generator, and place a bucket of Naphtha nearby (make sure it's contained!).$(p)When the Naphtha Fire spreads to the Turbine, and the Coal Generator starts a new operation, the Naphtha Fire will be extinguished, and will give the Coal Generator's next operation a x4 multiplier.$(p)Naphtha can be found rarely with the Pump by Dowsing in the Nether.
